definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Then the Army Corps of Engineer demanded a map of the proposed new flood plain.
sentences.chinese: 然后，工程师兵团要求的建议的新的冲积平原的地图。

sentences.english: Between Erhai andCangshan's dam, is a long shape silting alluviation plain.
sentences.chinese: 洱海和苍山之间的坝子，是一个狭长形的冲积平原。

sentences.english: The alluvial plains in Mesopotamia are perfectly suitable for high food production.
sentences.chinese: 美索不达米亚的冲积平原非常适合生产高生量的食物。

sentences.english: City is located in the deep basin Heilonggang Hutuo OXBOW for the alluvial plain.
sentences.chinese: 深州市地处黑龙港流域滹沱河故道，为冲积平原。

definition: to be located at/to be situated in
